byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

abstract: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei publicly endorses, for first time, nuclear pact with Iran and world powers, but warns that unless all sanctions are lifted, Tehran will walk away from deal; approval, included in letter to Pres Hassan Rouhani, also contains  accusations against United States, likely an effort to appease Iranian hard-liners; endorsement, final step in approval process, allows Iran to begin carrying out its obligations in accordance with deal.
lead_paragraph: The provisional backing by the supreme leader was accompanied by a warning that Tehran expected all sanctions to be lifted or it would walk away from the deal.

headline.main: Iran Nuclear Deal Wins Tepid Endorsement From Ayatollah Ali Khamenei
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Supreme Leader Supports Nuclear Pact but Warns U.S. on Sanctions

snippet: The provisional backing by the supreme leader was accompanied by a warning that Tehran expected all sanctions to be lifted or it would walk away from the deal.
